name: Ramada Paris Tour Eiffel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in August 2005, & found it to be a really good hotel for our purposes. We were originally booked in another hotel round the corner, but we found that there had been a mix-up & our booking had been inadvertently cancelled prior to arriving. The other hotel recommended the Ramada, & they booked us in straight away.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: There was myself, my wife, and our 13 & 2.5 year old daughters, & we found the room large enough for us - & our 5 large bags & baby stroller. Also, the rooms are air-conditionned - some other Paris hotels haven't got air-con, & with a baby it's something that we really need. Interestingly, with air-con the Ramada was still cheaper than the other hotel(AUD$150, compared with AUD$165 per room).
reviews.title: The name has changed!

reviews.text: Hamid at the front desk was a great help, & very polite & friendly. As well, twice a day he got ice for our baby's milk.
reviews.title: Great Hotel- reports unfounded March 05
comme ci comme ça hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, in-between two metro stations. The particular line runs out to Paris' Chinatown, where some good Asian food can be found. There are a couple of small supermarkets around the hotel, plus an internet shop, chemist, and other places that are handy for a tourist.

aka: Ramada Paris Tour Eiffel Hotel Paris
description: The hotel Ramada Paris Tour Eiffel is ideally situated in the heart of the 15th area, a very typical Parisian one. The hotel welcomes you in 46 comfortable rooms only 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides, 50 m from the metro station “La Motte Piquet Grenelle” from where it takes you 10 minutes to the convention Centre “ Porte Versailles”, the old Opera, the Champs Elysées, in 15 minutes to the business centre “La Défense “. In walking distance to UNESCO, River Seine, Trocadéro and Champs de Mars.
